abstract.text: The methods for responding to the life cycle events of your app’s scene.

legalNotices.copyright: Copyright © 2025 Apple Inc. All rights reserved.

inlineContent.text: This protocol defines methods that CarPlay calls when the scene connects and disconnects, as well as methods for responding to certain user actions. Use your implementation to provide the appropriate behavior for when these events occur. For example, creating and setting your root template when CarPlay launches your app and connects its scene.
You don’t create instances of your scene delegate directly. Instead, you specify the name of the class as part of the CarPlay scene configuration you add to your
file—see the example below—or that you return from your app delegate’s

code: <!-- Specify the name of your scene delegate class. -->

abstract.text: Integrate CarPlay in apps related to audio, communication, navigation, parking, EV charging, food ordering, and more.
An object that provides vehicle properties and configuration for the CarPlay environment.
A CarPlay scene that controls your app’s user interface.
The methods for responding to the life cycle events of your app’s scene.
Tells the delegate about the addition of a CarPlay scene to the app.
Tells the delegate about the addition of a CarPlay scene to your navigation app.
Tells the delegate when CarPlay removes a scene from your navigation app.
Tells the delegate when CarPlay removes a scene from the app.
Tells the delegate when the user selects a maneuver while the app is in the background.
Tells the delegate when the user selects a navigation alert while the app is in the background.
Use scenes to present your app’s content on the vehicle’s built-in screen.
Configure your CarPlay-enabled app with the entitlements it requires.
Make your CarPlay-enabled apps compatible with older system versions, such as iOS 13 and earlier.
Configure Simulator to run and debug your CarPlay-enabled app.
Retrieves the configuration data for UIKit to use when creating a new scene.
The group of methods that are fundamental to all Objective-C objects.
The core methods you use to respond to life-cycle events occurring within a scene.
